page.title: 12THE FORESTRY COMMISSION (1)
page.content: The Forestry Commission has an office in Brodick and controls most of the forest land on the island except that which is privately owned. The Forestry Commission employ eleven men on Arran and own approximately 20,000 hectares of land. 7,500 hectares of this is forested. The types of trees on Arran are mainly{SITKA SPRUCE}with some{LARCH and hardwood species. The Sitka Spruce grows best on Arran as it grows very well in any tupe of soil. Birch saplings have been planted recently on the String Road. A landscaping officer draws up plans showing which trees are to be cut down. The trees are usually felled when they are 50 years old unless they have already been damaged by storms or wind.
